--- params: id: "2015.04.469" title: "Object ID: 2015.04.469" image: "./../images/UM_2015.04.469_1.png" # body-header: Home categories: ethnographic description: "Wedding Vessel" --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {layout-ncol=2} Culture (UDF1): Isleta Object Name: Vessel Other Name: NA Rec From: Phillip L. Boucher Artist/Creator (UDF2): Stella Teller Locale (UDF10): NA Source (UDF3): Phillip L. Boucher Use (UDF5): NA Construction: (UDF6): NA Height: 17.78 Length: 0 Width: 13.97 ::: Description (UM) (UDF21): Polychromatic greenware vessel with two spouts and a handle connecting the spouts. The body of the vessel is white and a stairstep motif with geometric forms are painted on both faces. The rims have a thin painted black border, The handle has a curved line with dots. The artist signed the base, "Stella Teller Isleta N. Mex." Owner's Notes: White greenware Wedding Vase with parrot motif, red inside of spouts with black rims. Stella Teller, early work Acquired from The Adobe Gallery, Old Town, Albuquerque, NM No date or price of purchase was given. Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): NA ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
